result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric JD Cole-Pelzek

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric JD Cole-Pelzek in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Eric JD Cole-Pelzek.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY. Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense Jury Instructions Received and Filed.
Defense signed CCW DPA Received and Filed.

Defendant Eric JD Cole-Pelzek appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Eric JD Cole-Pelzek.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Case scheduled for DPA hearing. Court orders case adjourned for in-person hearing, Branch 15.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric JD Cole-Pelzek in court with Attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for status conference.  Parties are negotiating a possible deferred prosecution agreement (DPA).  Court set a DPA hearing date.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Eric JD Cole-Pelzek in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense received discovery and offer. Defense informed the court there may be a potential DPA offer, and that their client will be doing a TAD evaluation.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Eric JD Cole-Pelzek in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference.
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney John Krejci  to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $45 Per Month. Repayment to begin 30 Days after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel. . 
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: via Zoom  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Br 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 19.

Defendant Eric JD Cole-Pelzek in court.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Eric JD Cole-Pelzek not in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/03/2022 02:00pm
